summary: Email correspondence between defense attorney David Oscar Markus and the U.S. Attorney's Office regarding Ghislaine Maxwell's bail appeal. The emails discuss procedural matters including access to unredacted court documents, filing motions under seal, and expediting the appeal process.

persons.name: David Oscar Markus
persons.context: Attorney representing Ghislaine Maxwell in her appeal from the denial of her third bail application. He corresponds with the U.S. Attorney's Office about accessing unredacted documents and procedural matters.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant in the case U.S. v. Ghislaine Maxwell. She is appealing the denial of her third application for bail.

connections.description: Markus states he has been engaged to represent Maxwell in her bail appeal.

events.title: Markus Engaged for Maxwell Bail Appeal
events.description: David Oscar Markus informs the U.S. Attorney's Office that he has been engaged to represent Ghislaine Maxwell in her appeal from the denial of her third application for bail.

keyFacts: David Oscar Markus was engaged as defense counsel for Ghislaine Maxwell's bail appeal in March 2021.
The correspondence involves procedural negotiations about accessing unredacted court documents and filing motions under seal.
The case is governed by a protective order (ECF No. 36) which is binding on all counsel.
The U.S. Attorney's Office did not oppose expediting the court's consideration of the appeal but opposed shortening their response timeline.
